comments:
An exception was thrown on a freshly created Plugin with a View.  Use the 
following steps to recreate:

1) Went under the File menu -> New -> Plugin-in Project
2) "Plug-in Project": Entered project name "asdfghj" and clicked Next
3) "Plug-in Project Structure": Clicked Next
4) "Plug-in Content": Clicked Next
5) "Templates": Click "Create a plug-in using one of the templates" -> select 
Plug-in with a view -> click next
6) Click finish

Note: Milestone 9 deprecated IPluginDescriptor interface is required in the 
constructor for the AbstractUIPlugin class.

There is a new constructor which does not take any args.  The deprecation 
notice should direct you there.  If it does not, the UI team can fix.  If the 
problem si more that that the generated plugin uses the deprecated constructor 
than that would be a PDE issue.  Moving to PDE for clarification ('cause they 
like it when people do that...).

When I use the wizard to create a plugin, the plugin is created without any 
args.  The problem is when I run the Run-time Workbench, and I try to load my 
plugin I get the exception previously posted (ie. the workbench is trying to 
find the old constructor with the deprecated IPluginDescriptor).

Remove the dependency on org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility and things 
should work.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 63624 ***
